track.name: Me & My Bitch
comments: One of the few Biggie joints I don't really care for
Perfect example of how important context is... this is #2 on my all-time favorite stories Biggie told in his short lifetime... <3

The way he manages to change the intent behind the phrase "me and my b****"  over the 3 verses is brilliant. 1st verse paints it very negatively and the way he says "bitch" sounds very vulgar. Second time around he paints a Bonnie & Clyde all action relationship and the bitch sounds more endearing when he delivers it. Like their perverse yet loyal relationship can be summed up with the phrase. 3rd time... sounds like sorrow for the obvious reasons. Great track.
YOU LOOK SO GOOD I SUCKED ON YOUR DADDY'S DICK. Sorry, i had to lol.
why does this only have 2 shouts?!
This is just straight up good music right here. He tells a sad fucking story, just like Johnny Cash or Bob Dylan or any other amazing musician. And that's it.
